body_html:
GPU utilisation in the graph refers to percent of GPU memory being used, sorry for the ambiguity.

The example in itself is as small as I could get it. The reason the code has so many lines is mainly to allow for measuring the GPU memory consumption automatically when starting the sess.run.
But as I said earlier, at the end all that I do is run the following for different configurations

for i in range(self.steps):
    start = time.time()
    sess.run([net, train_op])
    durations[i] = time.time() - start
body_text:
GPU utilisation in the graph refers to percent of GPU memory being used, sorry for the ambiguity.
The example in itself is as small as I could get it. The reason the code has so many lines is mainly to allow for measuring the GPU memory consumption automatically when starting the sess.run.
But as I said earlier, at the end all that I do is run the following for different configurations
for i in range(self.steps):
    start = time.time()
    sess.run([net, train_op])
    durations[i] = time.time() - start
body:
GPU utilisation in the graph refers to percent of GPU memory being used, sorry for the ambiguity.

The example in itself is as small as I could get it. The reason the code has so many lines is mainly to allow for measuring the GPU memory consumption automatically when starting the sess.run.
But as I said earlier, at the end all that I do is run the following for different configurations
```
for i in range(self.steps):
    start = time.time()
    sess.run([net, train_op])
    durations[i] = time.time() - start
```
